API Documentation¶

Routines for solving a schrodinger equation

solvers.main()¶

Main function to solve the schrodinger equation for a given potential

File Io for the sglsolver module

fileio.read_energies(directory)¶

Reads the calculated energies from the file energies.dat from a directory.

Args.:
directory: directory in which the file with the energies are saved
Returns:calculated energies
Return type:energies
fileio.read_expvalues(directory)¶

Reads the expected value of the position operator and the uncertainty of the lacation measurement from the file expvalues.

Args.:
directory: directory in which the file with the values are saved
Returns:expected value of the poition operator sigma: uncertainty of the location measurement
Return type:exposval
fileio.read_int_pot(directory)¶

Reads the x range and the potential from the file potential.dat

Args.:
directory: directory with the file potential.dat
Returns.:
xrange: x values potential: V(x)
fileio.read_schrodinger_inp(directory)¶

Read the data input file and creates a Dictionarie with the data

Args.:
directory: The directory with the schrodinger.int file
Returns.:
indata: Dictionarie with the data from the input file
fileio.read_wavefct(directory)¶

Reads the wavefunctions from the file wavefuncs.dat

Args.:
directory: directory in which the file with the wavefunctions are saved
Returns:x values wavefct: array with the wavefunctions
Return type:xrange
fileio.write_energies(energies, directory)¶

Writes the energies in the file energies.dat in the directory with the given potential.

Args.:
energies: calculated energies directory: directory in which the file have to be saved
fileio.write_expvalues(exposval, sigma, directory)¶

Writes the expected value of the poition operator and the uncertainty of the location measurement in the file expvalues.dat.

Args.:
exposval: expected value of the poition operator sigma: uncertainty of the location measurement directory: directory in which the file have to be saved
fileio.write_int_pot(x_range, int_potential, directory)¶

Writes the calculated potential and the x values in a file (x, V(X))

Args.:
x_range: x values int_potential: discretized potential in the x range directory: directory to save the file potential.dat
fileio.write_wavefct(wavefct, xrange, directory)¶

Writes the wavefunctions and the x range in a file in the directory with the given potential

Args.:
x_range: x values wavefct: calculated wavefunction directory: directory in which the file have to be saved

Interpolates the potential from the indata and calculates the energies and normalized wavefunctions

interpolation.calc_expected_value(indata)¶

Calculates the expected value of the position perator and the uncertainty of the location measurement.

Args.:
indata: dictionary with with the name of the directory, min and max
x Values and the number of x points.
interpolation.interpolation_pot(indata)¶

This function interpolates the potential linear, cubic or polynomial and writes the result in a file (potential.dat).

Args.:
indata: dictionary with the interpolation points and the x range.
Returns.:
int_potential: discretized potential in the x range
interpolation.solve_evproblem(indata)¶

Solves the eigenvalue problem and returns the energies and wavefunctions.

Args.:
indata: dictionary with the mass, the ……
Returns.:
energies: eigenenergies wavefunc: wavefunction

Main function to plot the energies, the potential, the wavefunction, the expected value from the position operator and the uncertainty.

plotmain.main()¶

Main function to plot the data

Visualisation of the engergies, the potential and the wave functions.

visualisation.graph(indata, ymin, ymax, scaling)¶

Creates a plot of wavefunctions for a potential, depending on different energies. :param indata: dictionary with the directory, the min x values and the max

x values
Parameters:
  • ymin – min. value of the y-axis
  • ymax – max. value of the y-axis
  • scaling – scaling factor for the wavefunction

” Test’s for pytest, to see if results match the reference data.

Author: Malte Kehlenbeck

test_solvers.test_ev(testname)¶

(Ugly)Function to test Eigenvalues

Parameters:example – directory containing schroedinger.inp and ref_energies.dat
test_solvers.test_pot(testname)¶

Function to test potential

Parameters:
  • example – directory containing schroedinger.inp and
  • ref_potential.dat –
